data.title: update LICENSE to Apache 2.0
data.description:
I've been researching opensource projects that have been scaled successfully, such as Neon and Supabase. Seems like they use this license as it encourages the most engagement. Makes sense.

This is a considered and thoughtful position. 

It also remains as before that :
- this App will not be commercialized
- this App will be a concept, key users will be fellow developers interested in opensource communities
- any cloud solutions will be proprietary

Reference:
https://github.com/neondatabase/neon
https://github.com/supabase/supabase

data.title: E2E Testing: Confirm Integration of frontend and backend with `AuthRandomUser.spec.ts` pass. Previously E2E tests returned frontend only.
data.description:
Please provide a clear and concise description of the changes made in this PR.

## problem statement

E2E tests previously returned frontend only results -- test would run, handle frontend actions, then fail due to no connection to backend.

## Screenshots / Screen Recordings
Please attach relevant screenshots or screen recordings that demonstrate UI/UX changes, Component behavior and /or Error messages (if applicable). 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b3513fe0-b889-4528-a075-623944d811b8

see screenshot

## How to Test
Please provide step-by-step testing instructions. _If any specific test data or test accounts are needed, mention them here._

1. Pull this branch
2. Follow setup instructions correctly as per `README-developers.md`
3. Open terminal
4. `cd ../frontend; npx run test:dev:auth` will pass
5. additionally, can check visuals with `cd ../frontend; npx playwright test --ui` and run AuthRandomUser.spec.ts`

## Checklist
Before submitting this PR, the following **must** be confirmed:

- [x] Pulled the latest `main` branch and resolved any merge conflicts
- [x] Ran `cd frontend && npm run build` to confirm no type or build errors
- [x] Ran linter/formatter commands (e.g., `npm run lint`) and fixed warnings/errors
- [x] Manually tested the feature/fix on relevant browsers/devices (if UI-related)
- [x] Added or updated relevant documentation (if applicable)
- [x] Linked related issue(s) correctly in the PR description using [closing keywords](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/using-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue)
- [x] Added Screenshots to the PR where applicable. Screenshots are mandatory for any frontend, styling, or layout changes.

## Additional Notes
(Any additional information for reviewers, like known bugs, workarounds, or future improvements.)

further test coverage needed now in the frontend/e2e dir.

data.title: Deployment: configure automated Vercel workflow for `frontend/` and `backend/` with Github Actions. Commits produce preview branches. Merges produce push to production.
data.description: # problem statement all deployments require 1 developer to pull the branch, run `vercel --prod` command in backend and frontend to deploy. As the project scales, contributors are left entirely dependent on 1 person to manually deploy to production "branches" before merging the PR to main. # solution introduced github actions `.github\workflows\deploy-vercel-fullstack.yml` so that: - [x] when developer makes a pull request, backend and frontend are deployed to a "branch" in production. anyone can view the preview branches and confirm it's working as expected in production - [x] the branches `integrate` with each other -- 2 isolated branches for backend and frontend are always deployed after ANY commit. (any other approach unneccesary) - [x] a test runs in Github actions confirming that, on Vercel, the frontend branch has successfully integrated the backend branch introduced `.github\workflows\pr-merged-to-main.yml` - [x] when branch is merged to "main", the "main" Vercel branches for frontend and backend will be deployed and integrated to production website - [x] further testing required -- we can only validate by merging this PR to main ## Screenshots / Screen Recordings // How to test Please attach relevant screenshots or screen recordings that demonstrate UI/UX changes, Component behavior and /or Error messages (if applicable). click the deployed frontend branch (2nd down) to test. open the preview, go to `/test` and test the endpoints ## Checklist Before submitting this PR, the following **must** be confirmed: - [x] Pulled the latest `main` branch and resolved any merge conflicts - [x] Ran `cd frontend && npm run build` to confirm no type or build errors - [x] Ran linter/formatter commands (e.g., `npm run lint`) and fixed warnings/errors - [x] Manually tested the feature/fix on relevant browsers/devices (if UI-related) - [x] Added or updated relevant documentation (if applicable) - [x] Linked related issue(s) correctly in the PR description using [closing keywords](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/using-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) - [x] Added Screenshots to the PR where applicable. Screenshots are mandatory for any frontend, styling, or layout changes. ## Future fixes - confirm `.github\workflows\pr-merged-to-main.yml` deploys to production after merging this PR - fix failing console logs in branch test (see screenshot)

data.title: Refactor cleaned user model
data.description:
- This PR refactors and cleans up the user model by removing legacy UserModel files and updating endpoints and tests to use a unified set of user profile fields and new database functions. Key changes include:

- Removal of legacy user model files in backend/src/apps/user/models/* and updates in AuthService to reference new database functions.
- Updates to test files and e2e runners to align with new endpoint routes and consistent naming for profile fields (e.g., profileBio, profilePicture, profileLocation, profileWebsite, profilePrivate).
- Adjustments in Playwright and package configuration files to support the new testing and teardown behaviors.

data.title: Append LICENSE.md
data.description:
# problem statement

Under the current license contributors are not able to reuse ***their own*** code for other projects.

# Notes

Caveat #1 essentially allows contributors to reuse and redistribute code that they have authored in this project. Equally it protects IP theft from contributor to contributor.

- There should be as many non-financial incentives for this project as possible
- the risks associated with this project in general are significantly small as there is no commercial harm that can be done
- using a restrictive license for this project could do more harm than good as it would prevent contributors from reusing their own code a lot of the time. There should be as many non-financial incentives for this project as possible
- the worst edge-case is that a contributor "commercialises" this code in an external project, this would not really de-value the project in any way it's already limited to a concept app. I would argue that this would be a "good problem" as would require significant attention, popularity and reach for someone to get this far.
- contributors can "ringfence" sections of the code in `LICENSE.md` if necessary

Caveat #2 clarifies that the design is strictly copyrighted as it was donated generously from a third party

data.title: Deploy: working as expected in production via refactored models
data.description:
# validation guidance

- visit http://dottie-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app to test all apps (auth, assessment, chat, user)

# screenshots

## assessment
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/76bd7427-a4a2-4040-be04-149830fc1e20)

## chat
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f69d87b0-02a8-49a9-a09e-8422f63021be)

collapsible component reveals details of assessment:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c0c32dd-9e85-45e4-b01a-eb7254cf97e3)

## user
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d0823ec2-cdf8-4394-97f0-45976b64a2dc)





# overview of changes

## general architecture refinements & isolation of concerns

1. improved frontend architecture with isolated folders e.g. frontend/src/context/auth/,,, was moved to frontend/src/pages/auth/context/....
2. more isolated components for challenging files in frontend e.g. frontend/src/pages/assessment/results/Resultsdata/...
3. added dependency chain readmes in challenging files which supports debugging
4. improved backend assessment/ architecture with nested __test__ files
5. more reusable components in frontend architecture e.g. ContinueButton, BackButton
6. clarified role of frontend/src/components e.g. frontend\src\components\DottieMascot3D.tsx moved to frontend\src\pages\landing-page
7. Chore: Removed outdated stack_decisions.md in root
8. validated E2E backend with cd backend; npm run test:dev and npm run test:prod (development and production API endpoints for all apps confirmed as working)

## auth app

N/A

## assessment app

1. added delete button functionality
2. update assessment was not working, now fully removed (not included in Min Viable Product criteria)
3. flattened assessment data structure for better readability and cleaner code; as we migrate the database from localSQLite to production PostgreSQL, having a clean data model is crucial

## user app

1. compartmentalised update email and update username for cleaner seperation of concerns

## chat app

1. implemented sidebar and fullscreen workflow for chat app


# test driven development checklist - backend isolate

## unit tests

located in `backend/routes/[app]/__tests__`
run `npm test -- "routes/[app]/__tests__"`
> e.g. npm test -- "routes/setup/__tests__"

- [x] all major unit tests passing

<details><summary> click here to view details </summary>

## Setup Endpoints unit tests
run `npm test -- "routes/setup/__tests__"`

 - [x] `/api/setup/health/hello` | GET | Test endpoint that returns "Hello World from Dottie API!" |
 - [x] `/api/setup/database/status` | GET | Check database connection status |
 - [x] `/api/setup/database/hello` | GET | Test endpoint that returns a hello message from the database (SQLite or Azure SQL) |

## Authentication Endpoints
run `npm test -- "routes/auth/__tests__"`

 - [x] `/api/auth/signup` | POST | Register a new user account |
 - [x] `/api/auth/login` | POST | Authenticate user and get access token |
 - [x] `/api/auth/logout` | POST | Logout user and invalidate token |

## Assessment Endpoints
run `npm test -- "routes/assessment/__tests__"`

 - [x] `/api/assessment/send` | POST | Send assessment results from frontend context, generates a new assessmentId |
 - [x] `/api/assessment/list` | GET | Get list of all assessments for the authenticated user |
 - [x] `/api/assessment/:id` | GET | Get detailed view of a specific assessment by ID |
 - [x] `/api/assessment/:id` | DELETE | Delete a specific assessment by ID |


## User Endpoints
run `npm test -- "routes/user/__tests__"`

 - [x] `/api/user/me` | GET | Get current user |
 - [x] `/api/user/:id` | GET | Get user by ID (todo: replace with /api/user/me) |
 - [x] `/api/user/:id` | PUT | Update a user |
 - [x] `/api/user/:id` | DELETE | Delete a user |
 - [x] `/api/user/pw/update` | POST | Update current user's password |

## AI Chat Endpoints
run `npm test -- "routes/chat/__tests__"`

 - [x] `/api/chat/send` | POST | Send a message to the AI (Gemini API) and get a response |
 - [x] `/api/chat/history` | GET | Get chat history for the authenticated user, returns all conversations as a list |
 - [x] `/api/chat/history/:conversationId` | GET | Get a specific conversation by ID |
 - [x] `/api/chat/history/:conversationId` | DELETE | Delete a specific conversation |

</details>

## development tests (playwright)
run `npm run test:dev` 
this runs a singular integration test

*app (# endpoints):*
- [x] setup (x3)
- [x] auth (x3)
- [x] assessment (x4)
- [x] user (x5)
- [x] chat (x4)

## production tests
run `npm run test:prod` 
this runs a singular integration test

- [x] setup (x3)
- [x] auth (x3)
- [x] assessment (x4)
- [x] user (x5)
- [x] chat (x4)

# test driven development checklist  - frontend integration

## `developer mode` endpoints in localhost
run localhost as per `README-developers.md`, click on `developer mode` button on bottom right and test the endpoints.

- [x] setup (x3)
- [x] auth (x3)
- [x] assessment (x4)
- [x] user (x5)
- [x] chat (x4)

## `developer mode` endpoints in production
visit [production url](http://dottie-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app); click on `developer mode` and test the endpoints.

- [x] auth (x3)
- [x] assessment (x4)
- [x] user (x5)
- [x] chat (x4)

## manual integration testing in localhost
run localhost as per `README-developers.md`, manually test the apps

- [x] auth (x3)
- [x] assessment - can cycle through steps 1-5
- [x] assessment - can select symptoms and continue
- [x] assessment - can use "quick complete" button on step 1 (nice to have)
- [x] assessment - view correct data on results page: step 1
- [x] assessment - view correct data on results page: step 2
- [x] assessment - view correct data on results page: step 3
- [x] assessment - view correct data on results page: step 4
- [x] assessment - view correct data on results page: step 5
- [x] assessment - view correct data on results page: step 6
- [x] assessment save id 
- [x] assessment view id *(refactored results-details to be reusable component for results & history detail; get req can pass to Context and update before rendering, results-details renders from Context)*
- [x] assessment view list
- [x] assessment delete
- [x] user password change
- [x] user name change
- [x] user logout
- [x] user delete account
- [x] chat create new conversation
- [x] chat get list of conversations (sidebar) with {date, message_count, recent_message, assessment_id (fk), assessment_pattern (fk), user_id (fk)}
- [x] chat post/ get followup message to chat and save
- [x] chat placeholder response when no .env file
- [x] chat delete conversation
- [x] chat ai response with .env file

## manual testing in production
visit  [production url](http://dottie-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app); manually test the apps

- [x] auth (x3)
- [x] assessment (x4)
- [x] user (x5)
- [x] chat (x4)

***

</details>

# Checklist

- [x] pulled `main` branch to ensure latest version and no merge conflicts
- [x] ran `cd frontend; npm run build` and confirm no type errors
- [x] Issue link:

---

# Structure of assessment object before and after

<details> <summary> click here to view </summary>

## Before: Nested Structure

createdAt and assessment data were on level 1, with everything nested on level 2, the symptoms and recommendations on level 3

```json
{
  "id": "uuid-here",
  "user_id": "user-uuid-here",
  "assessment_data": {
    "age": "25-34",
    "pattern": "regular",
    "cycleLength": "26-30",
    "periodDuration": "4-5",
    "flowHeaviness": "moderate",
    "painLevel": "moderate",
    "symptoms": {
      "physical": ["Bloating", "Headaches"],
      "emotional": ["Mood swings", "Irritability"]
    },
    "recommendations": [
      {
        "title": "Recommendation 1",
        "description": "Description for recommendation 1"
      },
      {
        "title": "Recommendation 2",
        "description": "Description for recommendation 2"
      }
    ]
  },
  "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "updated_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```


## after: flattened structure

- symptoms split into physical and emotions
- camelCase converted to snake_case


```json
{
  "id": "uuid-here",
  "user_id": "user-uuid-here",
  "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "age": "25-34",
  "pattern": "regular",
  "cycle_length": "26-30",
  "period_duration": "4-5",
  "flow_heaviness": "moderate",
  "pain_level": "moderate",
  "physical_symptoms": ["Bloating", "Headaches"],
  "emotional_symptoms": ["Mood swings", "Irritability"],
  "recommendations": [
    {
      "title": "Recommendation 1",
      "description": "Description for recommendation 1"
    },
    {
      "title": "Recommendation 2",
      "description": "Description for recommendation 2"
    }
  ],
}
```

</details> 

## How to Test
1. Pull this branch
2. Setup the application as per `README-developers.md` and run localhost
9. Verify that assessment app occurs as expected, specifically:
10. save assessment 
11. view assessment detail
12. view assessment list

## Checklist
Before submitting this PR, please confirm the following:

- [x] Pulled the latest `main` branch and resolved any merge conflicts
- [x] Ran `cd frontend && npm run build` to confirm no type or build errors
- [x] Ran linter/formatter commands (e.g., `npm run lint`) and fixed warnings/errors
- [x] Manually tested the feature/fix on relevant browsers/devices (if UI-related)
- [x] Added or updated relevant documentation (if applicable)
- [x] Linked related issue(s) correctly in the PR description

## Further implementations

- get all unit tests working in frontend 1 folder at a time  -- Laurie to add to github issues
- #333 solve this issue
- #339 
- #338 
- #337 
- #336 
- #335 
- #334

data.title: Refactor(models): fix consistency issues in backend; confirmed working as expected in production
data.description:
# overview

1. flattened assessment data structure for better readability and cleaner code; as we migrate the database from localSQLite to production PostgreSQL, having a clean data model is crucial
2. improved backend assessment/ architecture with nested __test__ files
3. added dependency chain readmes which supports debugging
4. added delete button functionality
5. update assessment was not working, now fully removed (not included in Min Viable Product criteria)

Next refactoring op is to format the other models (auth, user, chat) in consistent snake_case which to help a graceful transition to production

# Screenshot(s)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6dda8412-fbf6-4ca3-a98f-cf27d2fe05b6)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c4e6e38d-bf5f-470e-b9c8-48e4f91f847b)


# Checklist

- [x] pulled `main` branch to ensure latest version and no merge conflicts
- [x] ran `cd frontend; npm run build` and confirm no type errors
- [x] Issue link:

---



## Before: Nested Structure

createdAt and assessment data were on level 1, with everything nested on level 2, the symptoms and recommendations on level 3

```json
{
  "id": "uuid-here",
  "user_id": "user-uuid-here",
  "assessment_data": {
    "age": "25-34",
    "pattern": "regular",
    "cycleLength": "26-30",
    "periodDuration": "4-5",
    "flowHeaviness": "moderate",
    "painLevel": "moderate",
    "symptoms": {
      "physical": ["Bloating", "Headaches"],
      "emotional": ["Mood swings", "Irritability"]
    },
    "recommendations": [
      {
        "title": "Recommendation 1",
        "description": "Description for recommendation 1"
      },
      {
        "title": "Recommendation 2",
        "description": "Description for recommendation 2"
      }
    ]
  },
  "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "updated_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```


## after: flattened structure

- symptoms split into physical and emotions
- camelCase converted to snake_case


```json
{
  "id": "uuid-here",
  "user_id": "user-uuid-here",
  "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "age": "25-34",
  "pattern": "regular",
  "cycle_length": "26-30",
  "period_duration": "4-5",
  "flow_heaviness": "moderate",
  "pain_level": "moderate",
  "physical_symptoms": ["Bloating", "Headaches"],
  "emotional_symptoms": ["Mood swings", "Irritability"],
  "recommendations": [
    {
      "title": "Recommendation 1",
      "description": "Description for recommendation 1"
    },
    {
      "title": "Recommendation 2",
      "description": "Description for recommendation 2"
    }
  ],
}
```

# todo list

- [x] assessment data fields moved to level 1
- [x] camelCase moved to snake_case e.g. createdAt => created_at
- [x] seperate physical_symptoms & emotional_symptoms
- [x] created_at instead of date _(*That's enough for first iteration, later iteration we can distinguish between: data, created_at, updated_at)_
- [x] recommendations remain nested but moved to level 1 > 2 from level 2 > 3
- [x] deleted unneeded update assessment endpoint
- [x] ensured all models in snake_case across SQLite and PostgreSQL
- [x] deployed frontend and backend

# testing criteria in development
- [x] Assessment Reqs x4 work as expected in backend tests E2E Dev
- [x] Assessment Reqs integration test passes as expected in E2E Dev
- [x] Assessment Reqs x4 work as expected in `developer mode`
- [x] Assessment Reqs x4 work as expected in `UI mode`
- [x] All endpoints pass in backend localhost via Playwright Master-integration

# testing criteria in production - backend isolate
- [ ] All endpoints pass in deployed backend Vercel-PostgreSQL via Playwright Master-integration
- [ ] implement ORM solution that ensures snake_case is consistently used in production
- [ ] tear down PostgreSQL and build again?

# testing criteria in production - frontend
- [x] confirm all setup tests in `developer mode` via manual testing
- [ ] confirm all auth tests in  `developer mode` via manual testing
- [ ] confirm all assessment tests.... via manual testing
- [ ] confirm all user tests... via manual testing

data.title: Flatten assessment data structure; add delete assessment button
data.description:
# overview

1. flattened assessment data structure for better readability and cleaner code; as we migrate the database from localSQLite to production PostgreSQL, having a clean data model is crucial
2. improved backend assessment/ architecture with nested __test__ files
3. added dependency chain readmes which supports debugging
4. added delete button functionality
5. update assessment was not working, now fully removed (not included in Min Viable Product criteria)

Next refactoring op is to format the other models (auth, user, chat) in consistent snake_case which to help a graceful transition to production

# Screenshot(s)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6dda8412-fbf6-4ca3-a98f-cf27d2fe05b6)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c4e6e38d-bf5f-470e-b9c8-48e4f91f847b)


# Checklist

- [x] pulled `main` branch to ensure latest version and no merge conflicts
- [x] ran `cd frontend; npm run build` and confirm no type errors
- [x] Issue link:

---



## Before: Nested Structure

createdAt and assessment data were on level 1, with everything nested on level 2, the symptoms and recommendations on level 3

```json
{
  "id": "uuid-here",
  "user_id": "user-uuid-here",
  "assessment_data": {
    "age": "25-34",
    "pattern": "regular",
    "cycleLength": "26-30",
    "periodDuration": "4-5",
    "flowHeaviness": "moderate",
    "painLevel": "moderate",
    "symptoms": {
      "physical": ["Bloating", "Headaches"],
      "emotional": ["Mood swings", "Irritability"]
    },
    "recommendations": [
      {
        "title": "Recommendation 1",
        "description": "Description for recommendation 1"
      },
      {
        "title": "Recommendation 2",
        "description": "Description for recommendation 2"
      }
    ]
  },
  "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "updated_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```


## after: flattened structure

- symptoms split into physical and emotions
- camelCase converted to snake_case


```json
{
  "id": "uuid-here",
  "user_id": "user-uuid-here",
  "created_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "age": "25-34",
  "pattern": "regular",
  "cycle_length": "26-30",
  "period_duration": "4-5",
  "flow_heaviness": "moderate",
  "pain_level": "moderate",
  "physical_symptoms": ["Bloating", "Headaches"],
  "emotional_symptoms": ["Mood swings", "Irritability"],
  "recommendations": [
    {
      "title": "Recommendation 1",
      "description": "Description for recommendation 1"
    },
    {
      "title": "Recommendation 2",
      "description": "Description for recommendation 2"
    }
  ],
  "updated_at": "2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```


# 🔗 dependency chain

<details>

<summary> click here to view </summary>


## Database Layer

1. `backend/db/migrations/updateFlattenedAssessmentSchema.js`
   - Migration script that implements schema changes
   - Adds individual columns for each assessment field
   - Converts nested JSON structure to flat columns

6. `backend/scripts/updateAssessmentSchemaToFlattened.js`
   - Runner script that executes the migration
   - Entry point for updating the database schema

## Backend Components

7. `backend/models/Assessment.js`
   - Update `create()` method to support flattened structure
   - Update `update()` method to handle both formats
   - Update `findById()` to transform data to appropriate format
   - Update `_transformDbRecordToApiResponse()` to handle flattened fields

8. `backend/routes/assessment/create/controller.js`
   - Update controller to handle flattened assessment format
   - Ensure proper validation and data transformation

9. `backend/routes/assessment/update/controller.js`
   - DELETED as not needed for mininum viable product

10. `backend/routes/assessment/getList/controller.js`
   - Update to handle flattened data retrieval
   - Transform database records to API format

11. `backend/routes/assessment/getDetail/controller.js`
   - Update to return properly formatted assessment data
   - Handle both flattened and nested formats

12. `backend/routes/assessment/validators/index.js`
   - Update validation logic to work with flattened structure
   - Ensure both nested and flat formats pass validation during transition

13. `backend/services/dbService.js`
   - Update JSON handling methods if needed for array fields
   - Ensure proper JSON stringification/parsing for symptoms and recommendations

## Frontend Components

14. `frontend/src/api/assessment/index.ts`
    - Update API client methods to work with new data structure
    - Ensure backward compatibility with existing code

15. `frontend/src/api/assessment/types.ts`
    - Update assessment interface definitions
    - Add proper typing for flattened structure
    - Maintain backward compatibility types during transition

16. `frontend/src/api/assessment/requests/postSend/Request.ts`
    - Update to handle sending flattened assessment data
    - Ensure compatibility with backend changes

17. `frontend/src/api/assessment/requests/getById/Request.ts`
    - Update to handle receiving flattened data structure
    - Transform data if needed for UI components

18. `frontend/src/api/assessment/requests/getList/Request.ts`
    - Update to handle receiving lists of flattened data
    - Transform data format if needed for components

19. `frontend/src/components/Assessment/` (adjust paths based on actual structure)
    - Update form components to handle flattened data
    - Update display components for symptoms and recommendations

## Testing Infrastructure

20. `backend/routes/assessment/__tests__/`
    - Update unit tests for assessment model
    - Update controller tests
    - Update API endpoint tests

21. `frontend/src/api/__tests__/unit/integration/runners/assessment.ts`
    - Update test fixtures to use new format
    - Update assertions to check for correct structure
    - Add tests for backward compatibility

22. `backend/dev/tests/master-integration/runners/assessment.js`
    - Update integration tests to work with flattened data structure
    - Test both formats during transition period

</details>

# todo list

- [x] assessment data fields moved to level 1
- [x] camelCase moved to snake_case e.g. createdAt => created_at
- [x] seperate physical_symptoms & emotional_symptoms
- [x] created_at instead of date _(*That's enough for first iteration, later iteration we can distinguish between: data, created_at, updated_at)_
- [x] recommendations remain nested but moved to level 1 > 2 from level 2 > 3
- [x] deleted unneeded update assessment endpoint

# testing criteria
- [x] Assessment Reqs x4 work as expected in backend tests E2E Dev
- [x] Assessment Reqs integration test passes as expected in E2E Dev
- [x] Assessment Reqs x4 work as expected in `developer mode`
- [x] Assessment Reqs x4 work as expected in `UI mode`

data.title: Chore: update path for vercel-build script in package.json to fix deployment build issues in backend
data.description:
Resolves issue with vercel see below before and after

# Before
```
PS C:\Projects\dottie\backend> vercel --prod
Vercel CLI 41.6.1
[...]
Error: Command "npm run vercel-build" exited with 1
Error: Check your logs at https://dottie-backend-q3zh3rc8a-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app/_logs or run `vercel logs dottie-backend-q3zh3rc8a-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app`
```

# After:
```
PS C:\Projects\dottie\backend> vercel --prod
Vercel CLI 41.6.1
🔍  Inspect: https://vercel.com/lmcreans-projects/dottie-backend/EHK6HSQSyoiQHryzSBAZo1ctyK7V [1s]
✅  Production: https://dottie-backend-nilmzg7p2-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app [1s]
```

# Screenshot(s)
Not applicable

# Checklist

- [x] pulled `main` branch to ensure latest version and no merge conflicts
- [x] ran `cd frontend; npm run build` and confirm no type errors
- Issue link: N/A
